result.execSummary:
The defendant Shawn R Gant was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Shawn R Gant

records.addlTxt: Order Regarding Return of Firearms received and filed.

Defendant Shawn R Gant not in court.  Alicia Kort appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Also in court Renae R Gant.
Case in court fo return on property hearing. Renae R Gant sworn in under oath. Testimony given by Renae Gant. The State proceeds with questioning of Renae Gant. The Court then proceeds with questioning of Renae Gant. The State takes no position at this time regarding the return of property to Renae Gant, however expresses concerns on the record. The Court makes decision that the firearm can be returned to Renae Gant.  Court grants petition.  Filed, signed Order.

Defendant Shawn R Gant not in court.  Lara Parker appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Also in court, Renae R Gant.
Case in court for return of property hearing. Renae Gant claims to be the owner of the firearm but does not provide the court with proof of ownership. For reasons stated on the record, Court orders matter adjourned in Branch 45.  Return of property hearing scheduled for February 6, 2018 at 01:30 pm.
Return of property hearing on January 3, 2018 at 01:30 pm.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Court will consider motion for expungement if defendant pays the fine and costs and has no further violations of the law raising to the level of probable cause.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1: Court ordered defendant to pay a fine of $100.00 plus all applicable court costs by 11/14/16 or the nonpayment penalty will be entry of a civil judgment.  Defendant must submit a DNA sample.

Court will consider motion for expungement if defendant pays the fine and costs and has no further violations of the law raising to the level of probable cause.
.

Defendant Shawn R Gant in court with attorney Adam C Essling.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.
Case calendared for plea/sentencing hearing.

AS TO COUNT 1: Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire, addendum and jury instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the complaint and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.

Defendant Shawn R Gant in court with attorney Adam c Essling.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Case calendared for projected guilty plea and sentencing. Court is in jury trial for today's proceedings. Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 37.   Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Shawn R Gant in court with attorney Adam c Essling.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Status conference hedl off the record. Defense counsel is still waiting for additional reports.   Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 37.   Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Shawn R Gant in court with attorney Adam c Essling.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 37.  Stipulated request for adjournment received and filed.  Status conference scheduled for September 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered Defendant not to be in possession of any firearms or any dangerous weapons; and to attend all future court appearances on this matter.

Defendant Shawn R Gant in court.  Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Defendant IS Public Defender eligible.  Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  The case is adjourned to Br. 37  for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 8/3/15 @ 1:30 pm
